alert.note: Alert for Clayton; Fayette (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 10:54PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fayette and Clayton Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1054 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Fayetteville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Jonesboro, Forest Park, Riverdale, Morrow, Lovejoy, Lake City, Woolsey, Lake Spivey, Inman, Bonanza, Jw Smith Reservoir, Lake Horton, and Irondale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Electrical appliances should not be used unless in an emergency. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
